item.title: Spring boot logs in Elastic Search with fluentd
item.description: If you deploy a lot of micro-services with Spring Boot (or any other technology), you will have a hard time collecting and making sense of the all logs of your different applications. In this article, I will show you a simple way to redirect your logs to Elastic Search with a Logback appender. The demo project is available on github. While this approach requires very little configuration, the 12 factors app manifesto actually recommends logging to stdout.
